CONJUGATES: floors (n. plural) | floors (v. 3rd person singular present) | flooring (v. present participle) | floored (v. past tense, v. past participle)
ETYMOLOGY: From Old English flōr 'floor, story (of a house)', of Germanic origin; related to Dutch vloer, German Flur 'corridor, entrance hall'.

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Noun: a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: The lower surface of a room, on which one may walk.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 房间的底部表面，供人行走。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The cat stretched out on the living room floor.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 猫舒展身体躺在客厅的地板上。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Noun: a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: All the rooms on one level of a building.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 建筑物中同一层的所有房间。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: Their new office is located on the tenth floor.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 他们的新办公室在十楼。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Noun: a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: The part of a legislative assembly, convention, or meeting hall where the members sit, and from which they may speak.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 立法机构、大会或会议厅中成员就座并可发言的部分。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The speaker yielded the floor to the opposing party's representative.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 议长将发言权交给了反对党的代表。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Transitive verb: a verb that takes one or more objects.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: He delivered a powerful punch that floored his opponent.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 他打出了强劲的一拳，将对手击倒在地。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Transitive verb: a verb that takes one or more objects.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: To surprise or confuse (someone) completely; to astonish or baffle.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 彻底使（某人）感到惊讶或困惑；使惊愕或困惑。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: Her unexpected resignation completely floored everyone in the department.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 她出人意料的辞职让部门里的每个人都大吃一惊。

REGISTER: Common. Used across various contexts, from daily conversation to more formal or specific settings, though some verb meanings are more informal.
